Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw and label different types of land habitats and water habitats, such as a forest and a pond.
The student can draw and label a variety of living things in each habitat, such as trees, squirrels, and ants in the forest, and fish, clams, and aquatic plants in the pond.
The student can illustrate and label patterns and differences in plant and animal diversity between the two habitats, such as noting more trees in the forest and more aquatic plants in the pond.
The student can organize their drawings to compare the variety of living things in each habitat, showing some specificity to the environments, such as lizards in the forest and fish in the pond.

The student can provide a description near the drawings explaining their understanding of biodiversity, such as writing about how forests have more terrestrial animals compared to the aquatic life in ponds.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently label all living things, occasionally forgetting to name certain plants or animals. *(student labels most but misses some)*

The student might show minor gaps in illustrating complex relationships, such as partially showing but not fully labeling interactions between animals and their environment. *(attempt made but incomplete)*
